I love this stuff! A heart healthy monounsaturated fat that raises good cholesterol and lowers the bad. High in heart healthy oleic acid. A very high smoke point and has No flavor. Buy at Costco or Walmart. It's rarely cold pressed and usually refined or centrifuge separated. Both are ok.

unless expeller pressed & non-GMO     Made with GMO plants and highly processed and refined at such high temperatures that is changed the fatty acid to a trans fat! They use a chemical called hexane to extract all the oil from the plant.

This is a good saturated fat because It's high in MCT’s and lauric acid. High smoke point and won’t burn easily. I prefer to buy extra virgin coconut oi compared to refined. Buy the big jug at Costco.
Only buy non-propellant oil spray that uses good fat like avocado oil or olive oil.
unless expeller pressed & non-GMO     Just as bad as canola oil.
The most processed and chemical laden oil.

If you want to buy canola peanut grapeseed sunflower oils it has to say EXPELLER PRESSED. This means it was not nearly as processed and subjected to high heat and chemicals. Also make sure It's non-GMO if buying canola or veggie oil because it came from soybeans and corn.
Only buy 100% grass-fed ghee. ALDI has a great price Thrive market brand is my favorite and I have heard Costco is starting to carry it.
Only buy expeller pressed. It's great for high heat cooking and has No flavor.
High in heart healthy monounsaturated fat but not expeller pressed. Usually sunflower or safflower oil.

donotbelieve the hype. Olive oil is safe to cook with and won’t burn and give you cancer. It's a monounsaturated fat that is stable from 370-400F.  Cook with olive oil and finish with extra virgin olive oil or use it for salad dressings. I actually buy the big jug of EVOO at Costco and cook with it because the price is right. Other good finishing extra virgin olive oil brands are California and lucini.

Another great finishing salt because it has large crystals and is crunchy.
You can cook or finish with this salt from the Pakistan mountains. I’m not a huge fan of cooking with it because the grains are small and tough to pinch. That’s why I prefer kosher.
Amazing finishing salt. I would not use for cooking.
Pure sea salt from Utah. Buy the kosher style for cooking

This type of table salt is highly processed refined and bleached. They add anti-caking agent so the salt flows out easily. All the natural minerals are bleached away and the flavor is straight up sodium chloride. You can get iodine from a good diet or supplements. It's not worth eating crappy salt for it.
Not Humanely raised.

I only recommend buying pasture raised eggs that are organic or non-GMO.You can find pasture raised eggs nationwide now! donotbe fooled by fancy names or marketing terms. It must say pasture raised on the box along with at least 108 square feet of room to roam for the hens. I would get the organic or the non-GMO variety because even pasture chickens get a supplemental feed of grain and you donotwant the GMO feed. Even better you can find co-op markets that sell locally sourced pasture raised eggs. Here in Chicago Dill Pickle co-op sells Mint Creek Farms eggs which are incredible because they have No soy in the feed.
You can find these at Trader Joe’s but not organic.
Perhaps not as good as others on this list but the best you can get at Costco.
If you cant find pasture eggs this is your next best option

I would highly advise buying organic chicken. Organic chicken means 100% organic non-GMO feed No animal byproducts No antibiotics outdoor access No irradiation No pesticides. The only place you can buy pasture raised chicken meat is from a local co-op or farmers market.

Avoid Yogurt made with milk that is not organic or grass-fed.Avoid yogurt Containing added sugar starches or natural flavors.Buy 100% grass-fed organic Greek style yogurt: the best yogurt you can possibly eat is 100% grass-fed organic Greek style yogurt. The nutritional profile of organic and grass-fed yogurt is fantastic and Greek style yogurt is strained which increases the protein and decreases the lactose.  Avoid buying flavored yogurts of any kind as they are loaded with sugar and cancel the probiotic effect. If you cant find 100% grass-fed buy organic I would not eat conventional dairy because the cows eat GMO grains.
Lactose free yogurt and organic for the win!
